intro: Stemmatodaphne, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It has small, glossy, evergreen leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its berries are usually red or yellow and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Botanically, it belongs to the family Viscaceae and is native to parts of Australia and New Zealand.
